title: Dashboard Load Performance with Large Data Sets
description: Verify the Mission Control Dashboard loads within 1.5 seconds and renders real-time data for 500+ map markers without UI lag or degradation.

steps.description: Simulate data source with 500+ active work orders and technician locations.
Navigate to Mission Control Dashboard.
Verify dashboard loads completely within 1.5 seconds.
Confirm all KPI cards, activity feed, technician heatmaps, and maps render with accurate real-time data.
Verify map responsiveness and smooth rendering of all markers without lag.

title: Work Order Creation and Auto-Assignment
description: Ensure new work orders are created successfully and intelligently auto-assigned to technicians based on location, skills, and availability within 100 milliseconds.

steps.description: Create a new work order with specific location, required skills, and priority via the wizard-form.
Verify work order is saved correctly in the system.
Confirm the automation engine processes the assignment within 100 milliseconds.
Check the work order is assigned to a technician matching location, skills, and availability criteria.

title: Work Order Status Update and SLA Monitoring
description: Validate real-time SLA monitoring triggers alerts for at-risk and breached work orders with appropriate automated escalations.

steps.description: Update a work order status to simulate progress towards SLA breach.
Check SLA status indicator updates to show at-risk status appropriately.
Simulate the work order reaching SLA breach condition.
Verify SLA breach alert is triggered and escalations workflows are initiated automatically.

title: Role-Based Access Control and Row-Level Security Verification
description: Verify that data access is correctly restricted based on user roles and row-level security policies.

steps.description: Login as Admin user and navigate through various data views (work orders, assets, technicians).
Confirm full access to all data without restriction.
Login as Dispatcher user.
Verify access to assigned work orders and related data only.
Login as Technician user.
Check visibility limited to assigned work orders and personal profile.
Attempt unauthorized data queries beyond permissions via API.
Confirm access is denied and no sensitive data is exposed.

title: Offline Support and Background Sync
description: Ensure the Progressive Web App supports offline access, data updates, background synchronization, and conflict resolution.

steps.description: Load the app and cache initial data.
Switch device to airplane mode (offline).
Access cached work orders and assets.
Verify data is accessible and UI functions correctly in offline mode.
Make changes such as status updates and asset edits while offline.
Restore network connection to trigger background sync.
Confirm local changes are synchronized with server without data loss.
Simulate data conflicts during sync, e.g. concurrent updates on same record.
Validate correct conflict resolution behavior and user notification.

title: Technician Scheduling and Conflict Detection
description: Verify accurate appointment booking, drag-and-drop rescheduling, and conflict prevention in the calendar module.

steps.description: Schedule a new appointment for a technician with valid time and duration.
Confirm appointment appears correctly in the calendar.
Drag-and-drop the appointment to a new time slot.
Verify calendar updates with new time and any overlapping appointments are detected.
Attempt to schedule or move an appointment overlapping an existing one.
Ensure the system prevents the conflict and notifies the user.

title: QR Code Scanning and Asset Tracking
description: Validate that scanning QR codes correctly fetches and displays asset details and maintenance history.

steps.description: Use QR scanner to scan asset QR code.
Verify asset details page opens with accurate and up-to-date information.
Check maintenance history and downtime tracking data are displayed.
Scan invalid or corrupted QR code.
Confirm appropriate error message appears and no incorrect asset data is shown.

title: Inventory Low-Stock Alerts and Reorder Notifications
description: Ensure inventory system triggers low-stock alerts and reorder notifications accurately and timely.

steps.description: Adjust inventory levels to fall below predefined low-stock thresholds.
Verify low-stock alert is triggered and visible on inventory dashboard.
Check reorder notification message content is accurate and actionable.
Simulate inventory replenishment.
Confirm alert and notification are cleared appropriately after stock update.

title: Real-time Notifications Delivery and Display
description: Verify that in-app notifications related to work order updates, SLA alerts, and system events are delivered and displayed in real time.

steps.description: Trigger a work order status update event.
Confirm real-time notification appears in Notification Center with correct details.
Trigger SLA at-risk and breach alert events.
Verify SLA alerts are delivered immediately and escalate if appropriate.
Generate a system event notification.
Check system event notification is received without delay.

title: Map & Location Services Route Optimization
description: Validate that the map displays work order and technician markers correctly, and route optimization minimizes travel time and distance.

steps.description: Open the map view with multiple active work orders and technicians.
Verify all markers show at correct geo-locations.
Invoke route optimization for a technician with multiple assigned work orders.
Confirm the optimized route is displayed and travel time/distance is minimized compared to default order.

title: Audit Logs Capture and Immutable Trail
description: Ensure all user actions and system automated processes are captured in audit logs immutably with accurate timestamps and user identification.

steps.description: Perform diverse system actions: create/update/delete work orders, asset edits, user profile changes.
Verify each action is logged with correct user ID, timestamp, and action details.
Attempt to modify or delete audit log records.
Confirm audit logs are immutable and cannot be altered or deleted.
Access audit logs with users having different permission levels.
Validate only authorized roles can view audit logs.

title: Search and Filters Accuracy Across Entities
description: Verify that advanced multi-criteria search and filters function correctly across work orders, assets, and inventory.

steps.description: Enter search terms and apply multiple filters simultaneously in work order view.
Confirm results accurately match search criteria and filters.
Perform similar multi-filter searches in asset and inventory views.
Verify correct filtering and quick search response.
Remove filters and search terms to reset views.
Check full unfiltered dataset is restored without errors.

title: User Interface Responsiveness and Accessibility
description: Ensure all UI components are responsive across devices and comply with accessibility standards (keyboard navigation, screen reader support).

steps.description: Open key modules (Dashboard, Work Orders, Assets, Scheduling) on devices of varying screen sizes.
Verify UI layout adapts responsively without content overflow or truncated elements.
Use keyboard only navigation to interact with menus, forms, dialogs.
Confirm all interactive elements are reachable and usable without mouse.
Enable screen reader and test content is read out meaningfully and labels are present.
Verify UI components comply with accessibility guidelines.
